definition: (usu. of people) difficult/demanding/troublesome/unreasonable/hard to deal with
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold
to wind around/to wrap round/to coil/tangle/to involve/to bother/to annoy

sentences.english: This little snake had a tougher customer the other day in the bit of eternity it was trying to swallow.
sentences.chinese: 那天，這難纏傢伙成爲小蛇難以下嚥的不朽片斷。

sentences.english: A difficult boss can make your time at work miserable.
sentences.chinese: 一個難纏的上司會讓你覺得在工作時度日如年。

sentences.english: There is more to managing difficult patients than relying on pharmacotherapy.
sentences.chinese: 應對難纏患者，藥物治療是不夠的。

sentences.english: He was up against some pretty tough competition.
sentences.chinese: 當時他要面對不少非常難纏的競爭對手。

sentences.english: Tony Snow had to crea the some how to wander (two careers that somehow intertwined).
sentences.chinese: 託尼斯諾有二份十分難纏的事業。

sentences.english: It is usually husbands who crack the jokes about difficult, interfering mothers-in-law .
sentences.chinese: 女婿們常愛拿難纏多事的丈母孃開開玩笑。

sentences.english: He is a very difficult man to speak to, and Bruce's behavior is worsening.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位很難纏的人，普魯斯的行爲正在變壞。

sentences.english: You don't want to appear high-maintenance before being offered the position.
sentences.chinese: 在得到這份工作之前你不想表現得是個難纏的人吧。

sentences.english: Alright, alright, no need to be a bridezilla.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，好吧，你不應該成爲一個難纏的新娘。

sentences.english: We're just having some cola before getting to the tough stuff--math.
sentences.chinese: 我們只是在對付難纏的數學之前先喝些可樂。

sentences.english: Toughs can have critters or terrors as pets or companions.
sentences.chinese: 強者可以有野生動物或難纏生物作爲寵物或夥伴。

definition: to bear grudges
source of calamity (esp. of women)
crafty and unruly
to open one's eyes/to widen one's horizons
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
thick stems and broad leaves (idiom)/boorish/rough and ready/sloppy
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to be unable to withstand a single blow/to collapse at the first blow
Trouble issues from the mouth (idiom). A loose tongue may cause a lot of trouble.
treachery/devious/a rogue
heart/intention/one's inclination/state of mind/to have the heart for sth/mood
to die in such a way that sb (or sth) else also perishes/to take sb down with oneself/to end in mutual destruction
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
wicked beyond redemption (idiom)/heinous
elusive/hard to pin down/enigmatic
